item.title: We are thrilled to share that Little Rock is one of the 16 new cities to achieve @BloombergDotOrg's @WhatWorksCities Certification in 2021. #CitiesWinWithData https://t.co/yMIzsvQyYh https://t.co/DrAlBC9CXD

We are honored to be recognized by @WhatWorksCities for our commitment to data-driven government and to be in such great company with other data and evidence-based city leaders. #CitiesWinWithData https://t.co/uKINCQLyrb https://t.co/HjZ7U55cJv

It's not our core issue, but we'd be radical about open data. If you run ğŸš… *anywhere* on tracks in EU, your timetable, ticketing & live running data must be available at fair cost, and in a standardised format, to allow @allaboard @OmioGlobal etc. to build services #EUYearOfRail

Internet coverage does not necessarily translate into internet use. 40% of global population live within range of a mobile signal but still fail to make use of it (aka â€œusage gapâ€) and this gap has persisted even as coverage has risen: https://t.co/tnGFxcoGT4 #Africa #Tanzania https://t.co/C4ZcXJWBgA

Great thread on how opening up govt. data has huge upsides.
But no govt. does it becoz it's politically disruptive.
IMO, better to first develop an open-data culture, by focusing on politically non-sensititive data. Once these show results, it'll be easier to demand more. https://t.co/47qdBbgEe6
